explanation: The tie-break check used the wrong label. The original line checked S[-1] == "A" inside the condition that decides to print "T", which made the tie case choose the wrong winner. I changed that check to S[-1] == "T" so that when counts are equal the last vote correctly determines the winner.
fixed_code:
N = int(input())
S = input().split()

T_W = S.count('T')
A_W = S.count('A')
print("T" if T_W > A_W or T_W == A_W and S[-1] == "T" else "A")
